content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron ore mining and smelting structure at position around (17.5, 72.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
- Electric mining drill at position (17.5, 72.5) facing down, powered but output blocked due to furnace belt blockage.
- Stone furnace at position (18.0, 75.0) fueled with coal, smelting iron ore, currently working but with full output inventory.
- Three wooden chests at positions (19.5, 75.5), (21.5, 75.5), and (21.5, 77.5), serving as storage for smelted iron plates.
- Burner inserters at positions (20.5, 75.5) and (20.5, 77.5), both fueled and moving iron plates between furnace and chests.
- Small electric pole at (15.5, 75.5) connected to power network.

This structure enables extraction, smelting, and staged storage of iron plates with improved inserter fuel status, though output belt blockage persists.

### Steam power generation structure at position around (-9.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at position (-9.5, -0.5) extracting water.
- Boiler at position (-5.0, 2.5) fueled with coal, currently working.
- Steam engine at position (0.5, 6.5) connected to boiler by pipes, generating power.
- Small electric poles near boiler (-4.5, -0.5), steam engine (0.5, 3.5), and newly placed pole at (15.5, 75.5) connected to power network.

This structure reliably generates electricity from steam power, supplying the factory’s electric network.

### Iron gear wheel assembly structure at position around (25.5, 80.5)
Consists of:
- Assembling machine 2 at (25.5, 80.5), connected to power network via small electric pole at (25.5, 77.5), but currently idle due to lack of iron plates input.
- Input wooden chest at (21.5, 75.5) feeding iron plates into assembly area.
- Output wooden chest at (25.5, 82.5), replaced and repositioned to free space.
- Burner inserters at (20.5, 77.5) feeding input chest and at (25.5, 83.5) moving output from assembling machine to output chest, both fueled and operational.

This structure is set up for iron gear wheel production with power and inserter fuel issues resolved, but still lacks sufficient input materials to start crafting.

ERROR TIPS

### Entity placement conflicts due to occupied tiles
- Attempts to place small electric poles near the steam engine at (0.5, 6.5) failed due to existing pole at (0.5, 3.5).
- To avoid these errors, check tile occupancy before placement.
- Increase spacing, change placement direction, or adjust reference position to find free tiles.

### Inserter fuel and inventory management
- Burner inserters at (20.5, 75.5), (20.5, 77.5), and (25.5, 83.5) were successfully fueled after prior fuel shortages.
- Ensure inserters have sufficient fuel to maintain operation.
- Monitor inserter inventories to prevent insertion failures due to full inventories.

### Assembly machine input shortages and crafting readiness
- Assembling machine 2 at (25.5, 80.5) remains idle due to missing iron plates despite power connectivity.
- Input and output chests are empty, indicating no materials are being supplied to the assembler.
- To mitigate, ensure continuous supply of required input materials (iron plates) to the assembling machine.
- Confirm inserters feeding the assembler and output chests are operational and properly fueled.

### Output blockage and power connectivity warnings
- Mining drill at (17.5, 72.5) still reports "furnace belt at drop position is blocked," causing output blockage.
- Furnace output inventory remains full, preventing further smelting output.
- Maintain clear output belts and chests to prevent blockage.
- Verify all machines are connected to the power network; recent pole placements have improved connectivity.

NAMESPACE
No user-defined functions have been defined by the agent
